data.title: Wikipedia founder.....Jimmy Wales.....from Huntsville!
data.meta_description: Had a conversation with an architect friend of mine today (who is an Auburn grad.) and we were talking about how much Wikipedia has grown - and has become...
data.text:
Had a conversation with an architect friend of mine today (who is an Auburn grad.) and we were talking about how much Wikipedia has grown - and has become such a huge web resource today for info....

My friend said the founder, Jimmy Wales, is an Auburn grad. - but I just looked his Wiki page up and U.A. is also listed as part of his educational background...

Earle - did you ever know him?

Can anyone share more about his Alabama education details?

My friend said for his work with Wiki he never set it up as a for profit enterprise....he was asked once why not - that he could be a billionaire - and his response was something to the effect "Why would I want to be a billionaire?"

I'm paraphrasing - but some of you may know more about him and his "story" - I would be interested in any stories about him if you have - TIA!

Had a conversation with an architect friend of mine today (who is an Auburn grad.) and we were talking about how much Wikipedia has grown - and has become such a huge web resource today for info....

My friend said the founder, Jimmy Wales, is an Auburn grad. - but I just looked his Wiki page up and U.A. is also listed as part of his educational background...

Earle - did you ever know him?

Can anyone share more about his Alabama education details?

My friend said for his work with Wiki he never set it up as a for profit enterprise....he was asked once why not - that he could be a billionaire - and his response was something to the effect "Why would I want to be a billionaire?"

I'm paraphrasing - but some of you may know more about him and his "story" - I would be interested in any stories about him if you have - TIA!

No, he's a good bit younger. Also, the founder of the Discovery Channel Family is John Hendricks, also from HSV. Dr. Mike Brown, the dethroner of Pluto to dwarf status is from here (I do at least know his mom). And, on the lighter side, Holbrook, the writer of "On The Fastrack," is from here. (Again, I know his dad.) It's modeled roughly on the Intergraph Corporation here. In one inside joke, one of the characters, Art Welder (euphemism for a ham-handed sloppy programmer) looks out the back of a trailer and says "Does this place feel sort of temporary to you." The license plate clearly starts with "47," which is what our Madison County plates starts with. That's a reference to the thousands of tech people continually moving in and out of Huntsville...
